result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfonzo Ray Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration, then may serve 2nd half of jail sentence on electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (Bond on file applied - balance due).
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
No abusive contact with Samantha Reitzloff.
  Submit DNA sample.
Participate in any counseling including Domestic Abuse program if recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Same huber and electronic monitor option as count 1.
Concurrent with: with Count 1

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Alfonzo Ray Diaz in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Counts 1, 2, & 3: W/H Sentence 24 mo probation with conditions. 
Statement of uncharged read-ins is provided to the Court.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1, 2, & 3: No Contest on each
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s) and the uncharged read-ins.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1, 2, & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Statement of Uncharged Read-ins is noted by the Court.
ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs with the joint agreement. 
Defendant apologizes to the Court.

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION****
Count 1: I/S Sentence -   120 days jail w/huber and serve 2nd half on electronic monitor, if eligible (1 day credit) - stayed
24 mo Probation
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
 Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
No abusive contact with Samantha Reitzloff.
  Submit DNA sample.
  Participate in any counseling including Domestic Abuse program if recommended by the agent.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge.

Count 2:  I/S Sentence -   120 days jail w/huber and serve 2nd half on electronic monitor, if eligible  - stayed
24 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as Count 1.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge.

Count 3: I/S Sentence -   120 days jail w/huber and serve 2nd half on electronic monitor, if eligible  - stayed
24 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as Count 1.  
Pay costs and DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge.

Defendant Alfonzo Ray Diaz in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is handed a copy of the criminal complaint.  Indicates he does read and speak english. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court enters a NOT GUILTY plea on the defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No contact with Samantha Reitzloff or her residence or place of employment.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant (d.o.b. 12-21-1996) appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Battery/Domestic, Violating Domestic Abuse No Contact Provision.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5/18/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
